Function Documentation

Hsp_Status_t BurnPublicKey ( uint32_t  pubKeyAddr,
uint32_t *  pubKey,
uint32_t  numOfWords,
bool  wordAccessible 
)

Burn fuse for public key of HSP Description: 

 1. Write public key to fuse permanently. The function caller needs to know about ecc support scenarios for the key.  
     a) If there is no ecc (software/hardware) support for the key, writing content will be ecc uncoded
     b) If there is ecc hardware support for the key, writing content will be ecc uncoded since the hardware 
         will encode the content, and program the encoded content to fuse
     c) If there is ecc software support (not hardware) for the key, caller function need to make sure writing content ecc encoded before 
         calling this method, since the hardware will not encode the content.  It is the caller method's
         software responsibility to encode the writing content
Parameters
uint32_tpubKeyAddr, the public key fuse address
uint32_t*pubKey, pointer to a storage large enough to hold the public key
uint32_tnumOfWords, public key length in number of words
boolwordAccessible, indicate if this is burning word by word, or by a block
Returns
fuse burn execution status
See Also
VerifySignature
Hsp_Status_t BurnSocIdFuse ( uint32_t *  socId)

Burn SOC ID fuse Description: 

 1. Write a SOC ID to fuse permanently.
Parameters
uint32_t*socId, pointer to a storage containing the SOC ID
Returns
fuse burn execution status
See Also
createSOCid
Hsp_Status_t BurnSoftwareFuse ( uint32_t  swFuseAddr,
uint32_t *  softwareFuse,
uint32_t  numOfWords 
)

Burn software fuse of HSP Description: 

 1. Write software fuse data permanently, which can contain product config and info, such as revocation. 
     Currently there is no hardware ecc support for software fuse.
     If there is ecc software support (not hardware) for the data, caller function need to make sure writing content ecc encoded before 
     calling this method, since the hardware will not encode the content.  It is the caller method's
     software responsibility to encode the writing content
Parameters
uint32_tswFuseAddr, the software fuse address
uint32_t*softwareFuse, pointer to a storage large enough to hold the software fuse data
uint32_tnumOfWords, software fuse data length in number of words
Returns
fuse burn execution status
See Also
ReadSVN
Hsp_Status_t BurnSoftwareFuseEcc ( uint32_t  swFuseAddr,
uint32_t *  softwareFuseUncoded,
uint32_t  numOfWordsUncoded 
)

Burn software fuse of HSP with ECC Description: 

 1. Ecc encode words, then burn them to software fuse lot of HSP.
Parameters
uint32_tswFuseAddr, the software fuse address
uint32_t*softwareFuseUncoded, pointer to a storage ecc uncoded software fuse data
uint32_tnumOfWords, software fuse data length in number of words
Returns
fuse burn execution status
See Also
ReadSVN, BurnSoftwareFuse

Returns

Hsp_Status_t FctrlProgramWords ( uint32_t  fuseWordAddr,
uint32_t *  data,
uint32_t  wordLen,
bool  wordAccessible 
)

Fuse controller program word Description: 

 1. Fuse controller writing a word data permanently to the fuse.  It should be used during provisionning
    for programming device data, such as AEB, SocId, public key, software fuse, etc...
Parameters
uint32_tfuseWordAddr, the fuse word address. Notice this is not bus address. It comes from the fuse map document. E.g., Security State address is 0 in the fuse map.
uint32_tdata, the data word to be burned to the fuse
uint32_twordLen, the number of data words to be retrieved from the fuse
uint32_twordAccessible, indicate if fuse access is word by word, or by a block. If it is by a block, the address needs to be the block's start address; else, an error will occur.
Returns
word program execution status
See Also
SetAEB
UpdateAEB
BurnSocIdFuse
DeriveECCPublic
WriteDeviceKey
Hsp_Status_t FctrlReadFuseWords ( uint32_t  fuseWordAddr,
uint32_t *  data,
uint32_t  wordLen,
bool  wordAccessible 
)

Fuse controller read programed words Description: 

 1. Fuse controller fetches word data from the fuse.
Parameters
uint32_taddres, the fuse word address. Notice this is not bus address. It comes from the fuse map document. E.g., Security State address is 0 in the fuse map.
uint32_tdata, the storage pointer for data word to be retrieved from the fuse
uint32_twordLen, the number of data words to be retrieved from the fuse
uint32_twordAccessible, indicate if fuse access is word by word, or by a block. If it is by a block, the address needs to be the block's start address; else, an error will occur.
Returns
fuse read execution status
See Also
SetAEB
UpdateAEB
BurnSocIdFuse
DeriveECCPublic

Hsp_Status_t GetPublicKeyFromFuse ( uint32_t  pubKeyAddr,
uint32_t *  pubKey,
uint32_t  numOfWords,
bool  wordAccessible 
)

Get public key of HSP from fuse Description: 

 1. Read public key from fuse.  The function caller needs to know about ecc support scenarios for the key.  
     a) If there is no ecc (software/hardware) support for the key, reading result will be ecc uncoded
     b) If there is ecc hardware support for the key, reading result will be ecc uncoded since the hardware 
         will decode the encoded fuse content, and put the result in gfc data registers
     c) If there is ecc software support (not hardware) for the key, reading result will be ecc encoded since the hardware 
         will not decode the encoded fuse content, and put the encoded result in gfc data registers.  It is the caller method's
         software responsibility to decode the encoded content
Parameters
uint32_tpubKeyAddr, the public key fuse address
uint32_t*pubKey, pointer to a storage large enough to hold the public key
uint32_tnumOfWords, public key length in number of words
boolwordAccessible, indicate if this is burning word by word, or by a block
Returns
register read execution status
See Also
VerifySignature
Hsp_Status_t GetPublicKeyFromRegs ( uint32_t  pubKeyRegAddr,
uint32_t *  pubKey,
uint32_t  numOfWords 
)

Get public key of HSP from gfc registers Description: 

 1. Read public key registers.  These registers will load public keys from fuse on startup. If there is hardware ecc support, 
     the register content is ecc uncoded, since hardware will do the decoding when loading the content.
Parameters
uint32_tpubKeyRegAddr, the public key gfc register address
uint32_t*pubKey, pointer to a storage large enough to hold the public key
uint32_tnumOfWords, public key length in number of words
Returns
register read execution status
See Also
VerifySignature

Hsp_Status_t GetSoftwareFuseFromFuse ( uint32_t  swFuseAddr,
uint32_t *  softwareFuse,
uint32_t  numOfWords 
)

Get software fuse of HSP Description: 

 1. Read software fuse from fuse, which can contain product config and info, such as revocation
     Currently there is no hardware ecc support for software fuse.
     If there is ecc software support (not hardware) for the data, the resulting read content will be ecc encoded.
     Caller function need to decode the encoded content ecc encoded  It is the caller method's
     software responsibility to ecc encode and decode the content
Parameters
uint32_tswFuseAddr, the software fuse address
uint32_t*softwareFuse, pointer to a storage large enough to hold the software fuse data
uint32_tnumOfWords, software fuse data length in number of words
Returns
Fuse read execution status
See Also
ReadSVN
Hsp_Status_t GetSoftwareFuseFromFuseEcc ( uint32_t  swFuseAddr,
uint32_t *  softwareFuseUncoded,
uint32_t  numOfWordsUncoded 
)

Get software fuse of HSP with ecc Description: 

 1. Read ecc coded software fuse data from fuse; perform ecc check and correction on the data
Parameters
uint32_tswFuseAddr, the software fuse address
uint32_t*softwareFuseUncoded, pointer to storage to hold the corrected and decoded software fuse data
uint32_tnumOfWordsUncoded, uncoded software fuse data length in number of words
Returns
Fuse read and ecc check and correct execution status
See Also
ReadSVN
Hsp_Status_t GetSoftwareFuseFromRegs ( uint32_t  swFuseRegAddr,
uint32_t *  softwareFuse,
uint32_t  numOfWords 
)

Get software fuse of HSP Description: 

 1. Read software fuse register, which can contain product config and info, such as revocation.  
     These registers will load software fuse from fuse on startup. Currently there is no hardware ecc support, 
     the register content should be ecc uncoded.
Parameters
uint32_tswFuseAddr, the software fuse gfc register address
uint32_t*softwareFuse, pointer to a storage large enough to hold the software fuse data
uint32_tnumOfWords, software fuse data length in number of words
Returns
register read execution status
See Also
ReadSVN

Hsp_Status_t WaitFctrlDone ( void  )

Poll for fctrl status register available.

Description:

  1. Read FCTRL Status register
  2. Poll while Busy is set.
  3. If any other error bits in Status are set handle Failure - trap()
Parameters
void
Returns
status for the waiting result
